p: As shown in Table 2, the most considerable quantity of essential oils extracted, calculated based on the dry weight of the plant ( v/ w), was recorded in L8b (5.20%, v/ w), followed by L9b (3.80%, v/ w), L6 (1.70%, v/ w) and L7 (1.30%, v/ w). It is important to note that the yield values increase at the flowering stage more than before and after flowering. As reported by several authors, the EOs concentration in inflorescences is dependent on the variety and environmental conditions [ 55, 56, 57].
